Articles.Content:
I have a separate copy of KSP with just RoverDudes mods

Yeah, I do stuff like that too. I have one for building atmospheric planes (KAX/Firespitter), one for distant travel, and one for massive space planes (B9). I just wish I didn't have to, I have 16 GB of ram, and I get to use 3.
I can't get my Honeybadger to stop from tipping itself onto its back and exploding every time it launches. What gives?

I can't get my Honeybadger to stop from tipping itself onto its back and exploding every time it launches. What gives?

Build it more balanced, or cheat and use davon throttle control (although it isn't cheating at all because who would build a VTOL capable craft without throttle control!?!?!?!?)

- - - Updated - - -

Yeah, I do stuff like that too. I have one for building atmospheric planes (KAX/Firespitter), one for distant travel, and one for massive space planes (B9). I just wish I didn't have to, I have 16 GB of ram, and I get to use 3.

Why would you need 3 installs, I have all of the big mods installed and my ram barely goes over 5GB ????
RocketBadger-Mining got to the Mun
Just filled up the RocketBadger using all its drills, fully loaded with ore, minerals, water, substrate, karbonite, monprop and fuel its 390 tonnes lol!! Still flies nicely on the Mun though

Great pack, can't wait to see how it develops!

Also, does the style of this pack remind anyone else of those old lego submarines? XP

Great pack, can't wait to see how it develops!

Also, does the style of this pack remind anyone else of those old lego submarines? XP

http://img.docstoccdn.com/thumb/orig/1596363.png

Not until you made the comparison, but it's pretty apt.

Build it more balanced, or cheat and use davon throttle control (although it isn't cheating at all because who would build a VTOL capable craft without throttle control!?!?!?!?)

Yeah, I've actually tried Davon Throttle Control for this (and let me say I find DVC to be remarkably lacklustre) and it just can't manage balancing the damn thing for more than a couple of minutes flight. I honestly think the next stage of this mod needs to be some sort of automated VTOL guidance/switching system.

Build it more balanced, or cheat and use davon throttle control (although it isn't cheating at all because who would build a VTOL capable craft without throttle control!?!?!?!

easier said than done. Especially trying to make one balanced both empty and full. And I have a really tough time figuring out the balance VS thrust with VTOL engines in the SPH.

May try also loading the throttle control mod.
DTC is good when you figure it out especially when combined with vertical velocity control. I have built some very stable and controllable VTOLS using the combination, give it another go

Just filled up the RocketBadger using all its drills, fully loaded with ore, minerals, water, substrate, karbonite, monprop and fuel its 390 tonnes lol!! Still flies nicely on the Mun though

Awesome! How did you get it to the Mun? Will it SSTO out of Kerbin?

Craft file plox? I'd love to study it in the SPH in order to get some understanding on balancing these beasts.

No not SSTO, sadly It used a big fat launcher with a HIDEOUS huge procedural fairing....

I normally make sure my fairings are much smaller than that....... or use radial boosters to make it look more sensible

Craft Files https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/64331679/RocketBadger-Mining-Booster.craft

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/64331679/RocketBadger-Mining.craft

Um you will need davon throttle control and probably tweakscale, maybe KW... not sure I have feckin loads of mods installed!

Also my designs are only superficially balanced because they don't need to be perfectly balanced when using Davon Throttle Control and TAC fuel balancer :D

Edited August 27, 2014 by Joachim

Just filled up the RocketBadger using all its drills, fully loaded with ore, minerals, water, substrate, karbonite, monprop and fuel its 390 tonnes lol!! Still flies nicely on the Mun though

That looks downright pretty next to the MKS bases. And yes, there's a very specific and somewhat consistent aesthetic I go for in all of the USI parts

Great pack, can't wait to see how it develops!

Also, does the style of this pack remind anyone else of those old lego submarines? XP

http://img.docstoccdn.com/thumb/orig/1596363.png

Not on the inspiration list, but I love the comparison

Yeah, I've actually tried Davon Throttle Control for this (and let me say I find DVC to be remarkably lacklustre) and it just can't manage balancing the damn thing for more than a couple of minutes flight. I honestly think the next stage of this mod needs to be some sort of automated VTOL guidance/switching system.

Well out of scope I just provide the parts - I'll let you guys figure out how to fly them

Build it more balanced, or cheat and use davon throttle control (although it isn't cheating at all because who would build a VTOL capable craft without throttle control!?!?!?!?)

- - - Updated - - -

Why would you need 3 installs, I have all of the big mods installed and my ram barely goes over 5GB ????

Yeah, I've actually tried Davon Throttle Control for this (and let me say I find DVC to be remarkably lacklustre) and it just can't manage balancing the damn thing for more than a couple of minutes flight. I honestly think the next stage of this mod needs to be some sort of automated VTOL guidance/switching system.
easier said than done. Especially trying to make one balanced both empty and full. And I have a really tough time figuring out the balance VS thrust with VTOL engines in the SPH.

May try also loading the throttle control mod.

The one I'd try for VTOL balancing is Throttle Controlled Avionics at http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/67270-Throttle-Controlled-Avionics-1-3-0-23-5-(April-6).

Build it more balanced, or cheat and use davon throttle control (although it isn't cheating at all because who would build a VTOL capable craft without throttle control!?!?!?!?)

- - - Updated - - -

Why would you need 3 installs, I have all of the big mods installed and my ram barely goes over 5GB ????

I separate them out not because of ram usage, but part clutter. Roverdudes stuff has it's own look and feel and I like to keep it all together. Likewise I have plans for other mods and putting them all together makes me sad.

I separate them out not because of ram usage, but part clutter. Roverdudes stuff has it's own look and feel and I like to keep it all together. Likewise I have plans for other mods and putting them all together makes me sad.

Ahhh you are highly organised :0 i go for the cluster.... option when it come to mods

And now the Badger, just Jeb's fun ride really, no cargo or drilling

Notice how I am using the reactor part as the central point of my craft with docking ports on the nodes on the top and bottom lined up as much as possible with the COM, COL and COT. This means I can do control from here on the docking ports for VTOL flight if I fancy it.

Now for the glamour shots....
I should really make one with little control surfaces rather than crap loads of SAS and RCS, handles like a bus when the RCS runs out.............

Joachim.

I figured I'd as you first here before troubleshooting in the other mod threads. I just installed Davon Throttle control. An odd thing is my blades no longer spin. If I don't put the throttle control part on the honeybadger the blades spin fine. but if I put the Davon part on they don't spin anymore. Have you seen that?

Ok, I'll see your sweet honeybadger pics and raise you this....

(Was doing some testing for the next Karbonite release that includes oceanic, and decided to have some fun)

Ok, I'll see your sweet honeybadger pics and raise you this....

(Was doing some testing for the next Karbonite release that includes oceanic, and decided to have some fun)

Considering that you went under the water, do you have hooligan labs's mod installed? Might be a good idea to throw in a water mod like that WITH the karbinite mod if we're going to be going in the water a lot (so we don't slam into it like concrete ;D)

Also, I don't have karbonite yet, so I'm confused. Can you currently "mine" the oceans, or is that still in the future?

Considering that you went under the water, do you have hooligan labs's mod installed? Might be a good idea to throw in a water mod like that WITH the karbinite mod if we're going to be going in the water a lot (so we don't slam into it like concrete ;D)

Also, I don't have karbonite yet, so I'm confused. Can you currently "mine" the oceans, or is that still in the future?

I went under water because that ship weighs in excess of 180 tons Only mod there is Firespitter, which is already bundled. Oceanic is coming in the next Karbonite patch (I have a part or two to wrap up)

Ok, I'll see your sweet honeybadger pics and raise you this....

(Was doing some testing for the next Karbonite release that includes oceanic, and decided to have some fun)

That is pretty damn sweet

- - - Updated - - -

Joachim.

I figured I'd as you first here before troubleshooting in the other mod threads. I just installed Davon Throttle control. An odd thing is my blades no longer spin. If I don't put the throttle control part on the honeybadger the blades spin fine. but if I put the Davon part on they don't spin anymore. Have you seen that?

Um hadn't noticed that but will have a look, probably something to do with how it is regulating throttle and how that relates to the blades animation.
With all your mods now, could you maybe make a Icon for the PartCatalog ? All your parts are already nicely sorted by PartCatalog but just with a "ugly" USI written and no nice icon
This looks amazing RoverDude!! How do you keep coming up with these awesome mods? Will this be able to be used to deliver MKS modules to non atmospheric bodies?
